intro: Ochranthe, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Ochranthe is native to regions of Africa and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
